resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
guyuqi commented on pull request #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427
 
 
   ARMv8 defines VMULL/PMULL crypto instruction.
   This patch optimizes crc32c calculate with the instruction when
   available rather than original linear crc instructions.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

emkornfield commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498176570
 
 
   @guyuqi thank you for the contribution.  Could you clarify if this code is an original contribution or if it was borrowed from another project? 
   
    If this was borrowed from someplace we need to make it has an Apache compatible license and update LICENSE.txt file to note the source.  
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498194436
 
 
   I have some questions:
   - did you benchmark this on a actual workload? It seems this implementation would only be faster on values larger than 1kB, and this seems highly unlikely (except perhaps an array of large strings)
   - where does the original algorithm come from? Could you add a reference somewhere?
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

guyuqi commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498206166
 
 
   The algorithm comes from the intel whitepaper:  [crc-iscsi-polynomial-crc32-instruction-paper](https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/white-papers/crc-iscsi-polynomial-crc32-instruction-paper.pdf) .
   We implement it with Arm64 crypto extension.
   The performance gets boost on a big size of data set.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498596827
 
 
   So at best there's a 10% improvement in `BM_HashLargeStrings`. That's a micro-benchmark, so gains in real-world composite workloads will probably be far smaller. I'm not sure it justifies adding this. @wesm @fsaintjacques Opinions?

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498599642
 
 
   @guyuki those two projects are LGPL which isn't directly compatible with the Apache license.  I think we would need the original copyright holder to give explicit permission to relicense it (@pitrou can you confirm?)  Can you clarify if you or your colleague are the original authors?

guyuqi commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498623772
 
 
   In the patch: 
   if data size larger than 1024, the code will go to linear crc32c computation.
   ```
   ...
   ..
   while ((nbytes -= 1024) >= 0) {
   ...
   ..
   .
   }
   ```
   From my benchmark , we will get ~ x2.01 speedups.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

   In the patch: 
   if data size lower than 1024, the code will go to linear crc32c computation.
   ```
   ...
   ..
   while ((nbytes -= 1024) >= 0) {
   ...
   ```

   From my benchmark , we will get ~ x2.01 speedups.

guyuqi commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-498623772
 
 
   In the patch: 
   if data size lower than 1024, the code will go to linear crc32c computation.
   ```
   ...
   ..
   while ((nbytes -= 1024) >= 0) {
   //parallel 32
   ...
   ..
   .
   }
   //linear crc32
   ```
   From my benchmark , we will get ~ x2.01 speedups.

wesm commented on pull request #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#discussion_r297333732
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/hash-util.h
 ##########
 @@ -72,80 +72,80 @@ class HashUtil {
 #endif
 
 #ifdef ARROW_HAVE_ARMV8_CRYPTO
-  /* Arm64 Parallel crc32 computation
-   *
-   * Algorithm comes from Intel whitepaper:
-   * crc-iscsi-polynomial-crc32-instruction-paper
-   * Implementation porting from Ceph:crc32c_aarch64.c
-   */
+/* Crc32c Parallel computation
+ *   Algorithm comes from Intel whitepaper:
+ *   crc-iscsi-polynomial-crc32-instruction-paper
+ *
+ * Input data is divided into three equal-sized blocks
+ *   Three parallel blocks (crc0, crc1, crc2) for 1024 Bytes
+ *   One Block: 42(BLK_LENGTH) * 8(step length: crc32c_u64) bytes
+ */
+#define BLK_LENGTH 42
   static uint32_t Armv8CrcHashParallel(const void* data, int32_t nbytes, uint32_t crc) {
-    uint32_t crc0, crc1, crc2;
-    const poly64_t k1 = 0xe417f38a, k2 = 0x8f158014;
-    uint64_t t0, t1;
-    const uint8_t* buffer = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(data);
-
-    /* Process per block size of 1024 Bytes
-     * A block size = 8 + 42*3*sizeof(uint64_t) + 8 = 1024
-     */
-    while ((nbytes -= 1024) >= 0) {
-      /* Prefetch 3*1024 data for avoiding L2 cache miss */
-      PREF1KL2(buffer, 1024 * 3);
-
-      /* Do first 8 bytes here for better pipelining */
-      crc0 = __crc32cd(crc, *(const uint64_t*)buffer);
-      crc1 = 0;
-      crc2 = 0;
-      buffer += sizeof(uint64_t);
-
-      /* Process block inline
-       * Process crc0 last to avoid dependency with above
+    const uint8_t* buf8;
+    const uint64_t* buf64 = (const uint64_t*)data;
 
 Review comment:
   Can you use C++-style casts in this file (`reinterpret_cast` and `static_cast`)?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

guyuqi commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-505703136
 
 
   Arrow-hashing-benchmark:
   
   ```
   ---------------------------------------------------------
   Benchmark                  Time           CPU Iterations
   ---------------------------------------------------------
   HashIntegers           21140 ns      21137 ns      33196   7.04989GB/s   902.385M items/s
   HashSmallStrings      195629 ns     195605 ns       3627   1065.28MB/s   97.5103M items/s
   HashMediumStrings     551390 ns     551311 ns       1270   2.35152GB/s   34.5966M items/s
   HashLargeStrings      322247 ns     322049 ns       2152   5.94996GB/s   5.92253M items/s
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

pitrou commented on issue #4427: ARROW-5458: [C++] Apache Arrow parallel CRC32c computation optimization
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4427#issuecomment-505756383
 
 
   So this is winning 10% on a micro-benchmark that's not representative of any real-world workload. I'm skeptical about maintaining this in our codebase for such a little gain.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
ARMv8 defines VMULL/PMULL crypto instruction.
This patch optimizes crc32c calculate with the instruction when
available rather than original linear crc instructions.
